00004 /*
00005 
00006 ## GENERAL INFORMATION
00007 ##
00008 ## FILE                                         fparams.c
00009 ## AUTHORS                                      P. Schmidtke and V. Le Guilloux
00010 ## LAST MODIFIED                        28-11-08
00011 ##
00012 ## SPECIFICATIONS
00013 ##
00014 ##      Handle parameters (parse the command line and sore values)
00015 ##      for the fpocket programm.
00016 ##
00017 ## MODIFICATIONS HISTORY
00018 ##
00019 -##     17-03-09        (v)  Segfault avoided when freeing pdb list
00020 ##      15-12-08        (v)  Added function to check if a single letter is a fpocket
00021 ##                                       command line option (usefull for t/dpocket) + minor modifs
00022 ##      28-11-08        (v)  List of pdb taken into account as a single file input.
00023 ##                                       Comments UTD
00024 ##      27-11-08        (v)  PDB file check moved in fpmain + minor modif + relooking
00025 ##      01-04-08        (v)  Added comments and creation of history
00026 ##      01-01-08        (vp) Created (random date...)
00027 ##      
00028 ## TODO or SUGGESTIONS

00031 ##      (v) Review the main function and handle all possible crashes.
00032 ##
00033 */

00035 /**
00036    ## FUNCTION:
00037         init_def_fparams
00038   
00039    ## SPECIFICATION:
00040         Initialisation of default parameters
00041   
00042    ## PARAMETRES: void
00043   
00044    ## RETURN: 
00045         s_fparams*: Pointer to allocated paramers.
00046   
00047 */
00048 s_fparams* init_def_fparams(void)
00049 {
00050         s_fparams *par = (s_fparams *) my_malloc(sizeof(s_fparams)) ;
00051 
00052         par->min_apol_neigh = M__MIN_APOL_NEIGH_DEFAULT ;
00053         par->asph_min_size = M_MIN_ASHAPE_SIZE_DEFAULT ;
00054         par->asph_max_size = M_MAX_ASHAPE_SIZE_DEFAULT ;
00055         par->sl_clust_max_dist = M_SLCLUST_MAX_DIST ;
00056         par->sl_clust_min_nneigh = M_SLCLUST_MIN_NUM_NEIGH ;
00057         par->pdb_path[0] = 0 ;
00058         par->basic_volume_div = M_BASIC_VOL_DIVISION ;
00059         par->nb_mcv_iter = M_MC_ITER ;
00060         par->min_pock_nb_asph = M_MIN_POCK_NB_ASPH ;
00061         par->refine_clust_dist = M_REFINE_DIST ;
00062         par->refine_min_apolar_asphere_prop = M_REFINE_MIN_PROP_APOL_AS ;
00063         par->clust_max_dist = M_CLUST_MAX_DIST ;
00064         par->npdb = 0 ;
00065         par->pdb_lst = NULL ;
00066 
00067         return par ;
00068 }
00069 
00070 /**
00071    ## FUNCTION: 
00072         get_fpocket_args
00073   
00074    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00075         This function analyse the user's command line and parse it to store parameters
00076         for the pocket finder programm.
00077   
00078    ## PARAMETRES:
00079         @ int nargs   :  Number of arguments
00080         @ char **args : Arguments of main program
00081   
00082    ## RETURN: 
00083         s_params*: Pointer to parameters
00084   
00085 */
00086 s_fparams* get_fpocket_args(int nargs, char **args)
00087 {
00088         int i,
00089                 npdb = 0,
00090                 status = 0 ;
00091 
00092         s_fparams *par = init_def_fparams() ;
00093         char *pdb_lst = NULL ;
00094         
00095         //read arguments by flags
00096         for (i = 1; i < nargs; i++) {
00097                 if (strlen(args[i]) == 2 && args[i][0] == '-' && i < (nargs-1)) {
00098                         switch (args[i][1]) {
00099                                 case M_PAR_MAX_ASHAPE_SIZE        : 
00100                                         status += parse_asph_max_size(args[++i], par) ;         break ;
00101                                 case M_PAR_MIN_ASHAPE_SIZE        : 
00102                                         status += parse_asph_min_size(args[++i], par) ;         break ;
00103                                 case M_PAR_MIN_APOL_NEIGH         : 
00104                                         status += parse_min_apol_neigh(args[++i], par) ;        break ;
00105                                 case M_PAR_CLUST_MAX_DIST         : 
00106                                         status += parse_clust_max_dist(args[++i], par) ;        break ;
00107                                 case M_PAR_SL_MAX_DIST            : 
00108                                         status += parse_sclust_max_dist(args[++i], par) ;       break ;
00109                                 case M_PAR_SL_MIN_NUM_NEIGH   : 
00110                                         status += parse_sclust_min_nneigh(args[++i], par) ; break ;
00111                                 case M_PAR_MC_ITER                        : 
00112                                         status += parse_mc_niter(args[++i], par) ;                      break ;
00113                                 case M_PAR_BASIC_VOL_DIVISION : 
00114                                         status += parse_basic_vol_div(args[++i], par) ;         break ;
00115                                 case M_PAR_MIN_POCK_NB_ASPH   : 
00116                                         status += parse_min_pock_nb_asph(args[++i], par) ;      break ;
00117                                 case M_PAR_REFINE_DIST            : 
00118                                         status += parse_refine_dist(args[++i], par) ;           break ;
00119                                 case M_PAR_REFINE_MIN_NAPOL_AS: 
00120                                         status += parse_refine_minaap(args[++i], par) ; 
00121                                         break ;
00122                                 case M_PAR_PDB_LIST :
00123                                         pdb_lst = args[++i] ; break ;
00124                                         
00125                                 case M_PAR_PDB_FILE                       : 
00126                                                 if(npdb >= 1) fprintf(stderr, 
00127                                                         "! Only first input pdb will be used.\n") ;
00128                                                 else {
00129                                                         strcpy(par->pdb_path, args[++i]) ; npdb++ ;
00130                                                 }
00131                                                 break ;
00132                                 default: break ;
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135         }
00136         
00137         if(status > 0) {
00138                 free_fparams(par) ;
00139                 print_pocket_usage(stdout);
00140                 return NULL ;
00141         }
00142         
00143         par->npdb = npdb ;
00144         
00145         /* Handle a file containing a list of PDB */
00146         if(pdb_lst != NULL) {
00147                 FILE *f = fopen(pdb_lst, "r") ;
00148                 if(f != NULL) {
00149                         /* Count the number of lines */
00150                         int n = 0 ;
00151                         char cline [M_MAX_PDB_NAME_LEN + 1] ;
00152                         
00153                         while(fgets(cline, M_MAX_PDB_NAME_LEN, f) != NULL) {
00154                                 if(strcmp("\n", cline) != 0) {
00155                                         n ++ ;
00156                                 }
00157                         }
00158                         fclose(f) ;
00159                         if(n == 0) {
00160                                 return par ;
00161                         }
00162                         
00163                         /* Allocate memory and store each line */
00164                         par->pdb_lst = (char **)my_malloc(n*sizeof(char*)) ;
00165 
00166                         f = fopen (pdb_lst, "r") ; 
00167                         int i = 0, l = 0 ;
00168                         while(fgets(cline, M_MAX_PDB_NAME_LEN, f) != NULL) {
00169                                 if(strcmp("\n", cline) != 0) {
00170                                         l = strlen(cline) ;
00171                                         if(cline[l-1] == '\n') {
00172                                                 l ;
00173                                                 cline[l] = '\0' ;
00174                                         }
00175                                         char *line = (char *) my_malloc((l+1)*sizeof(char)) ;
00176                                         memcpy (line, cline, l+1);
00177         
00178                                         par->pdb_lst[i] = line ;
00179                                         i ++ ;
00180                                 }
00181                         }
00182                         
00183                         par->npdb = n ;
00184                 }
00185         }
00186         
00187         return par;
00188 }

00190 /**
00191    ## FUNCTION: 
00192         parse_clust_max_dist
00193   
00194    ## SPECIFICATION:    
00195         Parsing function for the distance criteria first clustering algorithm.
00196   
00197    ## PARAMETERS:
00198         @ char *str    : The string to parse
00199         @ s_fparams *p : The structure than will contain the parsed parameter
00200   
00201    ## RETURN: 
00202         int: 0 if the parameter is valid (here a valid float), 1 if not
00203   
00204 */
00205 int parse_clust_max_dist(char *str, s_fparams *p) 
00206 {
00207         if(str_is_float(str, M_NO_SIGN)) {
00208                 p->clust_max_dist = atof(str) ;
00209         }
00210         else {
00211                 fprintf(stdout, "! Invalid value (%s) given for the single linkage max dist.\n", str) ;
00212                 return 1 ;
00213         }
00214 
00215         return 0 ;
00216 }
00217

00231         int: 0 if the parameter is valid (here a valid float), 1 if not
00232   
00233 */

00235 {

00244         return 0 ;

00275 /**
00276    ## FUNCTION: 
00277         parse_min_apol_neigh
00278   
00279    ## SPECIFICATION:    
00280         Parsing function for the minimum number of apolar contacted atom for an alpha
00281         sphere to be considered as apolar.
00282   
00283    ## PARAMETERS:
00284         @ char *str    : The string to parse
00285         @ s_fparams *p : The structure than will contain the parsed parameter
00286   
00287    ## RETURN: 
00288         int: 0 if the parameter is valid (here a valid int), 1 if not
00289   
00290 */
00291 int parse_min_apol_neigh(char *str, s_fparams *p)
00292 {
00293         if(str_is_number(str, M_NO_SIGN)) {
00294                 p->min_apol_neigh = (int) atoi(str) ;
00295                 if(p->min_apol_neigh < 0) p->min_apol_neigh = 0 ;
00296                 if(p->min_apol_neigh > 4) p->min_apol_neigh = 4 ;
00297         }
00298         else {
00299                 fprintf(stdout, "! Invalid value (%s) given for the min radius of alpha shperes.\n", str) ;
00300                 return 1 ;
00301         }
00302 
00303         return 0 ;
00304 }
00305

00504 /**
00505    ## FUNCTION:
00506         is_fpocket_opt
00507   
00508    ## SPECIFICATION:
00509         Say either or not a single letter code is a fpocket option (excluding
00510         input file/list option.)
00511   
00512    ## PARAMETRES:
00513         @ const char opt: The one letter code option.
00514   
00515    ## RETURN:
00516         integer: 1 if it's a valid option parmeter, 0 if not.
00517   
00518 */
00519 
00520 int is_fpocket_opt(const char opt)
00521 {
00522         if( opt == M_PAR_MAX_ASHAPE_SIZE ||
00523                 opt == M_PAR_MIN_ASHAPE_SIZE ||
00524                 opt == M_PAR_MIN_APOL_NEIGH ||
00525                 opt == M_PAR_CLUST_MAX_DIST ||
00526                 opt == M_PAR_SL_MAX_DIST ||
00527                 opt == M_PAR_SL_MIN_NUM_NEIGH ||
00528                 opt == M_PAR_MC_ITER ||
00529                 opt == M_PAR_BASIC_VOL_DIVISION ||
00530                 opt == M_PAR_MIN_POCK_NB_ASPH ||
00531                 opt == M_PAR_REFINE_DIST ||
00532                 opt == M_PAR_REFINE_MIN_NAPOL_AS) {
00533                 return 1 ;
00534         }
00535 
00536         return 0 ;
00537 }
00538 
00539 /**
00540    ## FUNCTION: 
00541         free_fparams
00542   
00543    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00544         Free parameters
00545   
00546    ## PARAMETRES: 
00547         @ s_params *p: Pointer to the structure to free
00548   
00549    ## RETURN: 
00550         void
00551   
00552 */
00553 void free_fparams(s_fparams *p)
00554 {
00555         if(p) {
00556                 if(p->npdb > 0 && p->pdb_lst != NULL) {
00557                         int i ;
00558                         for (i = 0 ; i < p->npdb ; i++) {
00559                                 if(p->pdb_lst[i] != NULL) my_free(p->pdb_lst[i]) ;
00560                         }
00561                         my_free(p->pdb_lst) ;
00562                 }
00563                 my_free(p) ;
00564         }
00565 }
00566 
00567 /**
00568    ## FUNCTION: 
00569         print_pocket_usage
00570   
00571    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00572         Displaying usage of the programm in the given buffer
00573   
00574    ## PARAMETRES:
00575         @ FILE *f: buffer to print in
00576   
00577    ## RETURN:
00578     void
00579   
00580 */
00581 void print_pocket_usage(FILE *f)
00582 {
00583         f = (f == NULL) ? stdout:f ;
00584 
00585         fprintf(f, M_FP_USAGE) ;
00586 }
00587 
00588 /**
00589    ## FUNCTION: 
00590         print_fparams
00591   
00592    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00593         Print function
00594   
00595    ## PARAMETRES:
00596     @ s_fparams *p : Parameters to print
00597         @ FILE *f      : Buffer to write in
00598   
00599    ## RETURN: 
00600   
00601 */
00602 void print_fparams(s_fparams *p, FILE *f)
00603 {
00604         if(p) {
00605                 fprintf(f, "==============\nParameters of fpocket: \n");
00606                 fprintf(f, "> Minimum alpha sphere radius: %f\n", p->asph_min_size);
00607                 fprintf(f, "> Maximum alpha sphere radius: %f\n", p->asph_max_size);
00608                 fprintf(f, "> Minimum number of apolar neighbor: %d\n", p->min_apol_neigh);
00609                 fprintf(f, "> Maximum distance for first clustering algorithm: %f \n", p->clust_max_dist) ;
00610                 fprintf(f, "> Single linkage clustering distance: %f\n", p->sl_clust_max_dist);
00611                 fprintf(f, "> Single linkage clustering neighbor: %d\n", p->sl_clust_min_nneigh);
00612                 fprintf(f, "> Refine clustering distance: %f\n", p->refine_clust_dist);
00613                 fprintf(f, "> Min number of apolar sphere in refine to keep a pocket: %f\n", p->refine_min_apolar_asphere_prop) ;
00614                 fprintf(f, "> Monte carlo iterations: %d\n", p->nb_mcv_iter);
00615                 fprintf(f, "> Basic method for volume calculation: %d\n", p->basic_volume_div);
00616                 fprintf(f, "> PDB file: %s\n", p->pdb_path);
00617                 fprintf(f, "==============\n");
00618         }
00619         else fprintf(f, "> No parameters detected\n");
00620 }
